column2: This represents the authority the Earth King wields over his Kingdom, whether he be a mere puppet of the Dai Li or absolute ruler.
This represents the authority and status of the Fire Lord, who at different points in time may be a simple monarch and in others, a conqueror or even a tyrant.

The unity of the Earth Kingdom can range from totally dissolved to fully united. Certain events and decisions can unify or bring chaos to the Earth Kingdom. When the unity of the Kingdom gets too low, the Earth King's subjects may stop paying tribute.

The Army of the Earth Kingdom represents how well prepared the Earth Kingdom is to fight a total war. At the unprepared level, the Kingdom's defences are in disrepair while at higher levels, every ruler in the Earth Kingdom may reap the benefits of greater preparation.

The Industry of the Fire Nation represents how technologically advanced the Fire Nation is becoming. This can range from the establishment of factories, to founding new military commands like the Southern Raiders and to exploiting conquered lands.
This represents the current stage of the Fire Nation's growth, whether it be founding colonies on the Earth Kingdom's shores, to waging a total war to conquer the entire world.
The Earth King is a mere puppet of the Dai Li and is merely the symbolic leader of the Earth Kingdom.
The Dai Li may control the Royal Court, but the Earth King is looking to change the status quo.
The Earth King has reclaimed his rightful place as sovereign of the Earth Kingdom. Some power however, is still in the hands of the Royal Council and the Dai Li.
The Earth King has reclaimed his royal powers, and reduced the Dai Li to the servants they should be.
The Earth King now rules with absolute power, answering to no one but themselves.
This represents the current customs and traditions of the Air Nomads, as decided upon by their highest authority: the Elder Council.

The Air Nomads pursue a policy of isolationism, cutting off all unnecessary links between the Air Temples and the outside world. Harmonious within, this policy enables the Air Nomads to endure the storms engulfing the wider world.

The Air Nomads stay true to their ancient traditions of pacifism and non-violence. While not strictly forbidden, outsiders who do not adhere to Air Nomad custom are often not permitted within sight of the Air Temples.

The Air Nomads have taken a much more pragmatic approach, in answer to the aggression of outsiders. While staying true to most of their traditions, they are fully prepared to confront any and all intruders on Air Nomad territory.

The Air Nomads have abandoned their pacifistic ways due to the dire situation they face. Not only will they confront all intruders with full force, they will go to great lengths to strike first against any would be threats to the Air Temples.
Vassals may fight against enemies both within and without the realm so long as Realm Peace is not enforced.

column6: Vasallos pueden luchar contra enemigos tanto dentro como fuera del Reino, siempre y cuando no se imponga la Paz del Reino.

column2: Vassals are forbidden from declaring war on enemies within the realm, but may attack external enemies so long as Realm Peace is not enforced.
column3: Les vassaux ont l'interdiction de d�clarer la guerre � leurs ennemis � l'int�rieur du pays, mais peuvent attaquer leurs ennemis � l'ext�rieur, tant que la paix dans le pays n'est pas d�clar�e.

column6: Vasallos tienen prohibido declarar la guerra a enemigos dentro del Reino, pero pueden atacar a enemigos externos siempre y cuando no se haya impuesto la Paz del Reino.

column2: Vassals are forbidden from declaring war both within and without the realm.
column3: Les vassaux ont l'interdiction de d�clarer la guerre, que ce soit � des ennemis � l'int�rieur du pays ou � l'ext�rieur.
column4: Vasallen d�rfen Feinden weder innerhalb noch au�erhalb des Reichs den Krieg erkl�ren.
column6: Vasallos tienen prohibido declarar la guerra tanto dentro como fuera del Reino.

column2: Air Nomad Law can only be changed by the Elder Council's decision.

�Y*�!Enables �YReclamation�! CB and �YSeize Province�! CB for all Air Nomads, and allows  Air Nihilist's to use the �YSeize Duchy�! CB.
�Y*�!Enables �YReclamation�! CB, �YSeize Duchy�! and �YSeize Province�! CB for all Air Nomads.

The Earth Kingdom is in tattered state, with all those not directly under the Earth King's rule no longer obligated to pay tax or even speak of allegiance to their King. While the Earth King cannot syphon tax from the territories or use Royal Authority against them, they can be conquered without cost.

All Territories in the Earth Kingdom will become independent.\nThe ruler of the Earth Kingdom may conquer de-jure Earth Kingdom land without penalty.\nRoyal Authority cannot be used to influence subjects.
The Earth Kingdom stretches further than any could hope to govern. As such, beyond the city of Ba Sing Se, the Earth King's subjects merely pay a token tax and give a pledge of their allegiance.

All subject Earth cultured rulers on de-jure Earth Kingdom land become tributaries of the Earth King and their lands Territories.\nThe Earth King may use Royal Authority to booster subject's opinion and carry out various special actions.
To progress, the Earth Kingdom must reform, rewriting the ancient laws to bring Ba Sing Se, and the many subjects who rule over the far flung regions of the Earth Kingdom, together.

All subject Earth cultured rulers on de-jure Earth Kingdom land become tributaries of the Earth King and their lands States.\nThe Earth King may use Royal Authority to diplomatically annex States and carry out various special actions.

The last barriers between the monarchy and absolute rule must be swept away for the Earth Kingdom to become the world's truly dominant power. Whomever sits on Ba Sing Se's throne should be worshipped above any Spirit.

This final reform will allow the ruler of the Earth Kingdom to restore Earth Monarchism and act as its leader. In addition, they may use Royal Authority to demand conversion of subjects to this new paradigm.

The Fire Lord is the ruler of the Fire Nation. While greatly powerful in their own right, the nobility still have much sway over the nation, and spiritual matters are exclusively the domain of the Fire Sages.
The Fire Lord has a greatly expanded power, discarding the opinion of nobles and sages to become a supreme authority and answerable to no one.
The Fire Lord has absolute authority under rule of law. Any dissent against that authority is high treason, punishable by death.
The title of Fire Lord is no more, replaced by the even greater label of Phoenix King, supreme ruler of the entire world.
The time has come to build up the Fire Nation's industry, both to improve her economy as well as create a suitable industrial base on which a war machine can be built.
The time has come to appreciate the many diverse skills the nation's forces possess by organising them into elite units.

The colonies will be an endless sink of resources unless their resources are put to proper use. The build up of industry in the colonies will help them become more self-sustainable and better yet, profitable.
If the Fire Nation is to remain the world's foremost military power, it must have the most advanced weapons.
Through research, it may be possible to field machines of war no one thought possible.
The Fire Nation is the greatest empire the world has ever seen, and the time has come to expand it. The Earth Kingdom is weak and fragmented, the perfect target for future expansion.
The time has come to settle colonists into our newly acquired territories, allowing our people room to grow even further.
The time will come where the Fire Nation must be ready to wage total war upon anybody who dares stand in the way of it's destiny.
We must strive to push the battlefield further and further from our borders, conquering key cities to further our expansion.
The time has come to achieve total victory and world domination.
The Earth King is no longer under Dai Li control.
The Earth King has control of the Dai Li and Royal Court.
The Earth King is an absolute monarch.
The Fire Lord is monarch of the Fire Nation.
The Fire Lord is supreme ruler of the Fire Nation.
The Fire Lord can imprison any traitor at will.
The Phoenix King's is the supreme ruler of the world.
The Warlord of the North, the eldest surviving son of Chin the Great, and rightful heir to his empire.
The Warlord of the South, the younger son of Chin the Great, and aspiring heir to his empire.

The 49th Earth King Huan, Monarch of Ba Sing Se, King of Kings and liege of all territories within the Earth Kingdom. Long as the Hou-Ting Dynasty ruled from the golden throne, but so much of their once great power has diminished. Earth King Huan is like his father before him, a puppet of the royal court, never having once stepped a foot outside his vast palace.

Firstborn of his father, inheritor of the great Fire Nation, Firelord Sozin is a wise and just monarch. A long time friend of the powerful Avatar Roku, and revered among his subjects, ambition is yet something that burns within Sozin's heart. For so long have the people of his nation prospered, while those beyond it's borders have been mired in nothing but war and starvation. As Sozin sees it, the world needs a strong leader such as himself to bring it progress and prosperity. His territorial ambitions however, may put him at odds with his old friend, Roku, who sees things quite differently�

The 50th Earth Queen Ji Houa, Monarch of Ba Sing Se, Queen of the Earth Kingdom and rightful ruler of it's territories. Under her father's reign, generations of stagnant peace was shattered by the Fire Nation's ruthless incursion into Earth Kingdom territory. After so many years of the Royal Court ignoring the crisis, war has finally arrived and foreign invaders sweep across the lands. A strong monarch must take control once again to steer the Earth Kingdom to survival.

The great and renown Avatar Kyoshi, born a peasant on the most distant shores of the Earth Kingdom, Kyoshi lived for over centuries, seeing many world shaping events pass. Perhaps one of the most lawful of Avatars, Kyoshi restored the order which her predecessor, Avatar Kurak, neglected. The Avatar's power was so great, it was said she split what is now known as Kyoshi Island from the mainland when she defeated Chin the Conqueror.

Firelord Zoryu has become the new Firelord after his father, Chaeryu's death. However tensions are high, as his illegitimate half-brother, Chaejin, claims the throne. Will you decide who comes out ontop?.

With the passing of his father, Sozin was crowned as Fire Lord, leader of the advanced and prosperous Fire Nation. Meanwhile, the Earth Kingdom continues to fracture under the watch of yet another Earth King who is a mere puppet of Ba Sing Se's treacherous royal court. As Sozin's friend, Avatar Roku, travels the world to learn the four elements, a celestial body once again hurtles towards the world, a comet said to pass through the skies once a century, always bringing the greatest of change as it burns through the skies...

With the passing of his father, Sozin was crowned as Fire Lord, leader of the advanced and prosperous Fire Nation. Meanwhile, the Earth Kingdom continues to fracture under the watch of yet another Earth King who is a mere puppet of Ba Sing Se's treacherous royal court. As Sozin's friend, Avatar Roku, travels the world to learn the four elements, a celestial body once again hurtles towards the world, a comet said to pass through the skies once a century, always bringing the greatest of change as it burns through the skies...

When Avatar Roku vanished, there was none left to oppose Firelord Sozin's ambitions to unite the entirety of the world under his rule. After decades preparing for total war, the Fire Nation struck in the cosmic event quickly becoming known as Sozin's Comet. With their firebending powers enhanced tenfold, the Fire Nation annihilated the Air Nomads in a merciless campaign that heralded the beginning of their great war.\n\nNow as the Fire Nation makes extraordinary gains against an unprepared Earth Kingdom, a new Avatar is nowhere to be found, believed perished with the Air Nomads. As the world descends into warfare unlike anything witnessed before, time will only tell if the Avatar ever returns�

Ever since Sozin invaded the Earth Kingdom, immeasurable bloodshed and destruction has spread across the globe. Now, the newly ascended Firelord Azulon knows the war his father started has dragged out longer than anyone thought possible. The Earth Kingdom has grown stronger and more unified under the military command of the Council of Five, an elite cadre of their best commanders. Meanwhile, in the freezing Arctic seas, the Fire Nation has suffering a humiliating defeat by the Northern Water Tribes. As the dream of global hegemony fades, Firelord Azulon is determined to prepare his people for a struggle that may outlast even his lifetime.

The war waged between Fire Nation and Earth Kingdom has now raged for almost ninety years. Despite the careful plans of Firelord Azulon, the war reaches yet another stalemate as his armies finally come within sight of Ba Sing Se's towering and unassailable walls. As skirmishes continue across the continent, the Earth Kingdom's strength cannot be broken as long as its great capital stands. Yet, maybe even this will not go unchallenged, as a new champion of the Fire Nation, Crown Prince Iroh, slayer of the last dragons, dreams of conquering the insurmountable�

After decades of warfare and devastation, Azulon's wise rule has ensured the Fire Nation's continued victory in the war against the Earth Kingdom. Now, Azulon's son, Crown Prince Iroh prepares to launch a final siege of the great city of Ba Sing Se. Those towering walls which surround the Earth Kingdom capital have never been breached in all history, but Prince Iroh is perhaps one of the greatest commanders the Fire Nation has even seen, already widely known and feared as the infamous 'Dragon of the West'.

With the deaths of both Prince Lu-Ten and Firelord Azulon, the ruthless Prince Ozai has taken the title of Firelord as his nation almost reaches victory in a war that has almost now spanned a century. Despite the losses suffered in the failed Siege of Ba Sing Se, the Fire Nation's army has continued to advance, the Earth Kingdom strongholds falling one by one. Meanwhile, the Navy prepares itself to once again attempt an invasion of the Northern Water Tribe. An era of Fire Nation domination looks certain, but news spreads that not only has the missing Avatar returned, but is an Airbender, long thought extinct for almost a century.

With the deaths of both Prince Lu-Ten and Firelord Azulon, the ruthless Prince Ozai has taken the throne as the Fire Nation almost reaches victory in a war that has now spanned a century. Despite the losses suffered in the failed Siege of Ba Sing Se, the Firelord's army has continued to advance, the Earth Kingdom strongholds falling one by one before them. Meanwhile, the Navy prepares itself to once again attempt an invasion of the Northern Water Tribe. An era of Fire Nation domination looks certain, but news spreads that not only has the missing Avatar returned, but is one of the Airbenders, a people long thought extinct since the early days of the war.

Avatar Aang has defeated Firelord Ozai, and the Firelord's once dishonoured son, Prince Zuko, has seized the throne and has declared an end to the long war between nations. In the wake of this sudden and unexpected peace, uncertainty grips the entire world. While the Avatar has returned, it is unknown whether this truce is but a short lull in a conflict that has lasted generations. The newly crowned Firelord Zuko faces ambitious enemies both at home and abroad, both in the form of his father's loyalists and the Earth Kingdom's unyielding opposition to the continued presence of Fire Nation colonies in their homeland.

After years of skirmishes and hostilities following the end of the Hundred Year War, stability is slowly beginning to return. To solve the crisis created by the Fire Nation's colonies in the Earth Kingdom, a solution has been reached in which a new nation would be created, independent of both countries. This United Republic of Nations would be ruled by a council composed of representatives from all nations, governed from the newly founded Republic City, and serve as a place where people of all nations can live in harmony.

After half a century of relative peace in the world, chaos again threatens the delicate balance. The Earth Kingdom which has stood for many millennia, has become a shadow of itself, as more and more territories break free of the tyrannical Earth Queen's rule. All this while a new, powerful militant group called the Equalists, emerge out of the continuing unrest in Republic City. Dissent grows around the world, and conflict appears certain. As the world edges closer to a new era, the successor to Avatar Aang, the young Avatar Korra, arrives in Republic City.

After half a century of relative peace in the world, chaos again threatens the delicate balance. The Earth Kingdom which has stood for many millennia, has become a shadow of itself, as more and more territories break free of the tyrannical Earth Queen's rule. All this while a new, powerful militant group called the Equalists, emerge out of the continuing unrest in Republic City. Dissent grows around the world, and conflict appears certain. As the world edges closer to a new era, the successor to Avatar Aang, the young Avatar Korra, arrives in Republic City.

After the assassination of the Earth Queen and the burning of Ba Sing Se, the Earth Kingdom ceased to be. With the Avatar once again absent from world affairs, the former territories and states of the Earth Kingdom have descended into anarchy. As lawlessness spreads across the continent, a charismatic and young commander by the name of Kuvira is quickly becoming known as the 'Great Uniter' after seizing control of the old capital of Ba Sing Se. Promising to bring order to a nation in chaos, Kuvira amasses more followers by the day. The world watches on with trepidation to see whether the Great Uniter will truly restore peace, or simply leave a trail of destruction.

With the death of feared and renown tyrant Chin the Conqueror, his empire has shattered into innumerable fiefdoms and warlords fighting over what remains. These are times of turmoil, as while many kingdoms who swore allegiance to Chin declare their independence, the remnant of Chin's fearsome army desperately attempt to retain control of their dwindling territory. Amongst this chaos, Avatar Kyoshi has led her people to settle upon a newly created island named in honour of her victory over Chin. All while the Earth King in Ba Sing Se plans to reconquer his lost kingdom�

The Earth King's attempt to reunite the entirety of the Earth Kingdom under his rule has gone spectacularly awry. As resistance from the many vassal kings and local nobility intensifies, the Kingdom's treasury is near empty, and the peasants in the great capital city of Ba Sing Se are rioting as new, harsh taxes are imposed. As the unrest continues, the Earth King has summoned Avatar Kyoshi to Ba Sing Se to resolve this crisis.

Centuries ago, the once grand civilisation of the Sun Warriors began a slow and certain decline into extinction. Since then, the Fire Islands on which their kingdom once rested, have been a battleground between warlords and tribal chiefs warring for supremacy. That has all changed as one lord has taken control of a vast swathe of the main island, defeating the warlords there and establishing a new nation, a Fire Nation, with the sole objective of unifying all of the Fire Islands under his rule.

With the passing of his father, Sozin was crowned as Fire Lord, leader of the advanced and prosperous Fire Nation. Meanwhile, the Earth Kingdom continues to fracture under the watch of yet another Earth King who is a mere puppet of Ba Sing Se's treacherous royal court. As Sozin's friend, Avatar Roku, travels the world to learn the four elements, a celestial body hurtles towards the world, a comet that will usher in a new era�\n\nAs a noble in the Fire Nation, things have never been better. It is a time of peace and prosperity under the Firelord's rule, but rumour has it that the Firelord has ambitions to make his domain even greater. What change this will bring, and potential gains for us, is yet to be seen.

With the passing of his father, Sozin was crowned as Fire Lord, leader of the advanced and prosperous Fire Nation. Meanwhile, the Earth Kingdom continues to fracture under the watch of yet another Earth King who is a mere puppet of Ba Sing Se's treacherous royal court. As Sozin's friend, Avatar Roku, travels the world to learn the four elements, a celestial body hurtles towards the world, a comet that will usher in a new era�\n\nAs a chief in the Southern Water Tribe, you could care less for the world's concerns. Life in the south is good, peaceful and prosperous as these  unforgiving frozen lands can be.

With the passing of his father, Sozin was crowned as Fire Lord, leader of the advanced and prosperous Fire Nation. Meanwhile, the Earth Kingdom continues to fracture under the watch of yet another Earth King who is a mere puppet of Ba Sing Se's treacherous royal court. As Sozin's friend, Avatar Roku, travels the world to learn the four elements, a celestial body hurtles towards the world, a comet that will usher in a new era�\n\nAs a chief of the Northern Water Tribe, the outside world's affairs are of little interest. The great Moon and Ocean Spirits continue their eternal dance in the Spirit Oasis, and there is great harmony between Man and Spirits.

With the passing of his father, Sozin was crowned as Fire Lord, leader of the advanced and prosperous Fire Nation. Meanwhile, the Earth Kingdom continues to fracture under the watch of yet another Earth King who is a mere puppet of Ba Sing Se's treacherous royal court. As Sozin's friend, Avatar Roku, travels the world to learn the four elements, a celestial body hurtles towards the world, a comet that will usher in a new era�\n\nAs a noble of the Earth Kingdom, you are far too aware of the Earth King's total lack of authority beyond Ba Sing Se. You're family have fought long and hard to keep your lands free of banditry and ambitious neighbours. You can only hope that the arrival of a new Avatar means greater stability for the world.

With the passing of his father, Sozin was crowned as Fire Lord, leader of the advanced and prosperous Fire Nation. Meanwhile, the Earth Kingdom continues to fracture under the watch of yet another Earth King who is a mere puppet of Ba Sing Se's treacherous royal court. As Sozin's friend, Avatar Roku, travels the world to learn the four elements, a celestial body hurtles towards the world, a comet that will usher in a new era�\n\nFar from worldly concerns, the Air Temples are a place of peaceful sanctuary far away from conflict and struggle. The Temples eagerly await the arrival of Roku, as the new Avatar sets out to learn Airbending.

With the passing of his father, Sozin was crowned as Fire Lord, leader of the advanced and prosperous Fire Nation. Meanwhile, the Earth Kingdom continues to fracture under the watch of yet another Earth King who is a mere puppet of Ba Sing Se's treacherous royal court. As Sozin's friend, Avatar Roku, travels the world to learn the four elements, a celestial body hurtles towards the world, a comet that will usher in a new era�\n\nYou and your tribe could care less for the Fire Nation, Earth Kingdom and Avatar. You have a simple goal, the continued survival of your tribe, but perhaps it is time to expand beyond these lands.

With the passing of his father, Sozin was crowned as Fire Lord, leader of the advanced and prosperous Fire Nation. Meanwhile, the Earth Kingdom continues to fracture under the watch of yet another Earth King who is a mere puppet of Ba Sing Se's treacherous royal court. As Sozin's friend, Avatar Roku, travels the world to learn the four elements, a celestial body hurtles towards the world, a comet that will usher in a new era�\n\nIt is clear to you that the Fire Nation is perhaps the greatest empire in history. For now, it enjoys a tranquil peace but it's loyal people would eagerly follow you as their Firelord to war if you so desired. The Earth Kingdom is weak and chaotic, perhaps in need of your strong leadership...

With the passing of his father, Sozin was crowned as Fire Lord, leader of the advanced and prosperous Fire Nation. Meanwhile, the Earth Kingdom continues to fracture under the watch of yet another Earth King who is a mere puppet of Ba Sing Se's treacherous royal court. As Sozin's friend, Avatar Roku, travels the world to learn the four elements, a celestial body hurtles towards the world, a comet that will usher in a new era�\n\nAs Earth King, you are all too aware of the machinations of the royal court and your Dai Li agents. Perhaps it is time for change, and for you to restore order and stability to your Kingdom. You will have to tread carefully however, as the Dai Li are always watching.

column2: Spirituality represents the knowledge and regard one has for spiritual matters.
Honour represents the true strength of the individual.
Freedom represents the true strength of the individual.
Equality represents the true strength of the individual.
Civility represents the true strength of the individual.
For long as the tribe's remember, they have controlled the sand to survive the harshness of the dunes.
Firebending Dojo's can impart the basics of Firebending to the nation's youth
The Academies are institutions which can prepare more Firebenders for military service.
The Dojo's are institutions which can prepare more Earthbenders for military serivce.
The Academies are institutions which can prepare more Earthbenders for military serivce.
The Waterbending Masters are venerable wielders of the art of Waterbending and they can impart their wisdom on the younger generations.
While a Nomad is often travelling, the Monastery is the place that all Airbending Nomads call home.
This factory is dedicated to the production of Tundra Tanks, powerful weapons in the Fire Nation war machine.
Royal Guard of Ba Sing Se
Aztlan is the ancestral home of the dragons, and their last remaining safe haven. Protected by the last remnants of the Sun Warriors, a few surviving Dragons dwell within.

It is time we lend a helping hand to [Root.GetTitledFirstName], spending a great deal of capital and time to finally bring order to our vassal's territories. By helping others, we may help ourselves build a stronger, more stable realm.
This province is home to a vast industrial complex, manufacturing both goods for the economy and weapons for our armies.
This chemical plant allows us to mass manufacture useful mixtures, both to aid in other industries as well as provide plentiful medicine to the masses.
This agricultural plant can process raw produce into preserved foodstuffs, eliminating our reliance on yearly harvests and allowing us to supply food to our armies far from home.
This factory is dedicated to the manufacture of civilian goods, greatly pleasing the capitalists and nobility in our realm.
This factory is dedicated to the manufacture of luxury goods, all of course to be consumed by the upper classes of our realm.
This steelworks allows us to build stronger armour for our soldiers, and maybe even manufacture larger, heavy armoured war machines.
This weapons factory provides the weapons and gear needed to equip our army.
The production laboratory is dedicated to enhancing and improving upon our manufacturing and construction process.
The military laboratory is dedicated to enhancing our soldier's equipment and improving our ability to wage war.
The research laboratory is dedicated to theoretical research.
A talented Firebender, [GetFirstName] will likely be able to strike fear into anyone with [GetHerHis] abilities.
A powerful Earthbender, [GetFirstName] will likely carry on that power in our bloodline.
A brilliant Waterbending Master, [GetFirstName] is the pride of our tribe.
An Airbending Master, [GetFirstName] is worthy of carrying on our traditions.
